Before you get started, review the following prerequisites:
Your device must have Google Play services version 11.4.x or higher installed
Install the Google Pay app and add a payment method
Add a payment method to Google
Adhere to our Google Pay API Acceptable Use Policy and the Google Play developer policy
Imports the dependency

To develop an app using the Google Play services APIs, you need to set up your project with the Google Play services SDK, which is available from the Google maven repository. To test your app when using the Google Play services SDK, you must use either: A compatible Android device that runs Android 4.0 or higher and includes Google Play Store. The Android emulator with an AVD that runs the Google APIs platform based on Android 4.2.2 or higher.
Add Google Play Services to Your Project
1.Open the build.gradle file inside your application module directory.
2.Add a new build rule under dependencies for the latest version of play-services, using one of the APIs listed below.
3.Ensure that your top-level build.gradle contains a reference to the google() repo or to maven { url "https://maven.google.com" }.
4.Save the changes, and click Sync Project with Gradle Files in the toolbar.
*You can now begin developing features with the Google Play services APIs.
